page.title: 07THE OLD S&D RAILWAY, BRUTON
page.content: The Somerset and Dorset railway was built in 1852 and opened in 1854. It started in Burnham on Sea going to Glastonbury and then later onto Cole in Bruton.Many local business men were involved in setting up the enterprise,such as James Clark,a shoe manufacturer from Street. The line was called the Slow and Dirty,as well as the Swift and Delightful and was a popular route. It shortened the journey from Bristol to Plymouth and made it unnecessary for steamers nto carry goods around the dangerous Lands End.However,the railway never made a vast profit, simply because it did not carry enough traffic.It closed down in 1954 and nowadays only the bridges,viaducts and old station houses remain,such as those seen in area.
